utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: What are you so excited about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the latest issue of SkyMall.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh really, darling, who subscribes to SkyMall? Isn’t perusing all that dreck on the plane enough?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dreck? Mother, I will have you know this is the gateway to the hottest new inventions in the world. Where else can you find a remote control that has a bottle opener…

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think it’s Alexis’ decision letter from Stanford University.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, kiddo. You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s just makes it so real. She grew up so fast.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, what do you expect? Her to live here forever?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, her, yes. You …

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Watch it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that the mail?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. You have one here from a Mr. Stan Ford. Is that anyone you know?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, darling?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I – I didn’t get in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh sweetie, I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But I picked all my classes. I bought T-shirts. I had it all planned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How could Stanford think she’s not worthy? She’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Last week you didn’t want her to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but I didn’t not want her to get in. I was sure she would get in. You got in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well … I wouldn’t now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyway, put your bruised ego aside. I’m sure she’s crushed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well actually, right now she’s in denial. When I left she was on the phone with Admissions explaining to them that they made a mistake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s the body?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: That is an excellent question.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean there’s no body?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nope, just lots of blood. Whoever's it is, there’s no way they survived.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So where’d they go?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You’re the one with all the crazy theories, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Walking dead.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: But there are indications that the body was moved.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: I think I know who moved it. I’ve got witnesses that say they saw an unmarked white van fleeing the scene just after 7AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They get an eye on who was behind the wheel?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but we’ve got unis canvassing for eyewitnesses and checking every street level security cam in a five block radius.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tire tracks. Okay, get a cast of the tire treads. CSU might be able to get make and model.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s two different sized footprints. There were at least two of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but there’s no tread on the footprints.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Must’ve been wearing booties.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Missing body, killers who literally cover their tracks … anyone else getting a quick strike assassin squad vibe?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh c’mon Castle, you’re not saying it’s some type of black ops job?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not saying it. The evidence is saying it. I’m betting this guy’s buried at sea by now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, there’s an imprint in the blood.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, it looks like a box or a case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Might have been our victim's.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nuclear launch codes, probably.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan, there’s a pattern. Let’s see if CSU can ID it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, no, sorry. It’s just that word, pattern. Jenny and I, we’re still registering for the wedding. China, silverware, stemware, sheets, not to mention …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: CSU imprint. Got it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, I’m pretty sure I’ve got a cause of death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean besides massive blood loss.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gunshots. Neighbors heard a pair go off at 6:40 this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 6:40? You sure?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, positive. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because Ryan’s witnesses saw a van racing out of here at 7.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who would kill someone, wait for them to bleed out, then take their body?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I guess that rules out “quick strike” assassin squad.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN GATES
utterance.content: An imprint in the blood is your best lead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, based on stitching, CSU determined the briefcase was an Underwood, which is pricey, and only two local shops sell them. They’re giving us customer information.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Sounds like a long shot at best.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re waiting on tire tread analysis and Detective Ryan is overseeing the review of over fifty security cameras looking for that van.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What about the victim? Any closer to an ID?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Based on blood Dr. Parish determined that our victim is a male, so we’re looking for missing persons reports of men in that area.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Men. You’ve narrowed the victim pool down to men.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, well … in New York City that actually eliminates over 4 million women, so…

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I don’t know what the Mayor sees in you, but I know how you’re alike. He’s term limited.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe if I sent her –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: - flowers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So an investigation without a body. That’s kind of new, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah … you know, there’ve been murder investigations where authorities haven’t found the body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but in those cases they still know who the victim is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Father of four disappears on fishing trip, blood found in family garage.” Where do you start when you don’t know who the victim is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You … I - … you know, you could …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We really need to find the body, don’t we?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Pretty much.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I may be able to help. Security cam footage near the alley clocked three vans that matched our witnesses' description, two Astros and an EconoLine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s the EconoLine. Tire tread analysis just came back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got plates?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, the EconoLine is registered to a PW Storage. It’s only six blocks from our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The plates match.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Door.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s in these things?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Judging from the size of them, you almost expect there to be –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: People! Geez. They’re people. They’re people.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They look … frozen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell is this place?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who are they all?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does anyone else have the sudden urge to run to the streets screaming ‘they’re here’?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, this is Detective Beckett. I need every CSU tech –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Movement. Movement 10’o’clock.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turn around!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Killing and freezing people is your job?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cryonics. That explains the room of human popsicles.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turn around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To be brought back to life in a science fiction future where death has a cure.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Think they can put me under until the wedding?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you know he was dead before we did?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That explains the timeline problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even if that’s true, what were you thinking, moving a shooting victim? Why didn't you call 911?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His brain isn’t alive, it’s dead. He’s dead.

utterance.speaker: DR ARI WEISS
utterance.content: That’s a matter of opinion. Dr. Ari Weiss, CEO of Passageway. This is my attorney, Johnny Rosen. I imagine you have many questions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Starting with who’s the murder victim you took from my crime scene?

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: His name is Lester Hamilton, a biology professor at Hudson University.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here, can you call it in?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m on it.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: He also happens to be an old friend. Marvin Medical School. It’s ironic he died so young.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: He conducted cutting edge research in developing life extension techniques.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not that it did him any good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he worked with you?

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: No. Lester focused on how to extend life before death. I created Passageway in order to extend hope for future life. After death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got any celebrities in here? Ted Williams? Jack Frost?

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: We don’t discuss our clients.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you’re going to have to discuss this one. Lester Hamilton was murdered and my ME will be taking custody of his body as soon as she gets here.

utterance.speaker: ROSEN
utterance.content: Detective, our client, Professor Hamilton, has an iron clad agreement with Passageway to have his body cryo-preserved upon his death. Short of a court order, he’s not going anywhere. And any attempt to take him would constitute tortes interference and we would sue you and the NYPD into oblivion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: DA won’t back us up on this one. They say that the case law is murky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll say it’s murky. A life extension researcher is killed, then a shadowy cryonics company absconds with the body? This has all the hallmarks of a vast and insidious conspiracy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m still trying to figure out how to explain it to Gates.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: They steal our victim and then threaten to sue us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, it’s a legal chicken and egg problem. Since Hamilton’s body is on private property we can’t get it without a warrant, but it’s going to be tough to get a warrant because without the body we can’t even prove he was murdered.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You get that double speak from their counsel?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, sir. My mother was a lawyer. Anyway, trust me. This is the argument that they will make.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay then, where are we?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the cryonics technician said Hamilton was shot twice in the chest. They turned over his clothes and based on the holes in the shirt it looks like it was a large caliber bullet. There’s still money in his wallet, suggesting it wasn’t a random mugging.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, what about the briefcase?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Technicians said that there wasn’t a briefcase at the scene. I called up Hamilton’s wife; she was adamant that he left the apartment this morning with a briefcase in hand. She’s on her way in right now with a Dr. Philip Boyd. He’s a colleague of Mr. Hamilton’s.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hamilton’s office at Hudson University was broken into three days ago and his computer was smashed. Security never found out who did it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Check into it. See if you can find something that campus cops missed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like something in that office of briefcase was worth killing for.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then find out what, Detective. And get the wife to release his body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA HAMILTON
utterance.content: I can’t do it. I have to honor Lester’s wishes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Hamilton, you do understand that without your husband’s body we might not be able to solve his murder.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: If preservation is discontinued he’s going to be gone forever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well with all due respect, he already is gone forever.

utterance.speaker: PHILIP BOYD
utterance.content: Lester would dispute that. He and I have been colleagues at Hudson for twenty years now and uh, he’s a true believer. For him, the keys to life extension, to reversing death itself, were within reach, so he would never give up his chance at revival.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: Do you know why he chose to focus on life extension? We fell madly in love with each other. He told me that one lifetime together wasn’t enough. He wanted more. So do I.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Hamilton, we think that whoever killed your husband might have stolen his briefcase. Do you know what was in it?

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: His research. For the Ambrosia Project. He always had it with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ambrosia, as in the food Greek gods ate to achieve immortality?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was the Ambrosia Project exactly?

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: Philip, how would you explain it?

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: Ah, it’s a little outside my wheelhouse, but … Lester was developing a pharmaceutical implant that caused the body to produce young cells instead of aging ones. He expected it to extend human lifespan by ten years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Treatment like that would be worth a fortune to Big Pharma.

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: Billions. But most of the money would have gone to Beau Randolph.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beau Randolph? The guy behind College Girls Gone Crazy?

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How is a ­ – how is a porn mogul connected to all this?

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: Us researchers take our funding where we can get it. Randolph made a killing in porn and now he fancies himself a venture capitalist. He’s funding Lester’s research, you know.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: He was. Lester cut all ties with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: Lester wanted to take an open source approach – publish his research online and then develop it with his peer to speed up results.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that way no one could hold a patent on the results.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how did Randolph feel about that?

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: Oh, they had awful fights about it. But Lester was adamant. In fact, he was supposed to upload the data today.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did your husband and Mr. Randolph have their falling out?

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: Three days ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Three days ago. That’s when his office was broken into.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: Beau Randolph is distasteful, of course, but … do you really think…?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think that losing billions of dollars is motive for murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, not only is Beau Randolph the proud owner of a Smith and Wesson .45 automatic –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is a large enough caliber to have created that entry wound in our victim.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He also has a carry permit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wha-? I couldn’t even get a carry permit. How did he get one?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The hard way. Several guys saw their girlfriends in his videos and beat the hell out of him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No longer jealous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The gun still doesn’t tie him to our murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but this might – a charge on our vic’s credit card. At 6:30 this morning he bought breakfast at Medusa Diner. I talked to the waitress, guess who was with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beau Randolph.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And there was a whole lot of yelling going on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 6:30. That’s 10 minutes before Hamilton was shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Ambrosia Project. Sounds like a Robert Ludlum novel where the millionaire playboy kills a researcher to get his hands on a secret formula for eternal life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, ten years is not eternal life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Would you do it? Would you get the implants?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I don’t think I need them. Huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I mean the pharmaceutical implants.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I could live to 100 instead of 90? No, I think I will pass.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if you could stay the same way now for the next ten years?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t want to stay the same.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How could you not want 10 extra years?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, one thing I’ve learned is that you never know how much time you have and if I thought I had more, I might just end up wasting it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re going to have to get those implants, otherwise you’ll get older and 10 years from now I’ll still be exactly the same.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Isn’t that how you’ll be anyway?

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. Mr. Randolph will be right out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great, thank you.

utterance.speaker: PRODUCER
utterance.content: Everyone here for Sorority Pillow Fight #7 c’mon back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone needs to get these girls clothes made of actual fabric.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, when did you become so judgmental about practically naked women?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since my daughter hit college age.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And there he is. Defiler of co-eds.

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. Beau Randolph. Are you sure you’re not here to audition for my ‘Post-docs Play Doctor’ series?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: Then what can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can answer a few questions about Lester Hamilton.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like why did you kill him?

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: Yeah, I was with Professor Hamilton at the diner this morning. The only crime was how bad the food was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Witnesses say that you fought.

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: That’s right. I sunk millions into his research and suddenly he wants to give it all away? There’s one thing internet porn has taught me. You don’t get rich by giving it all away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that why you killed him? So you could secure Ambrosia before he uploaded it for everyone to see?

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: It’s why I walked home and called my lawyer to issue an injunction.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The doorman said you came home at 7:10.

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: Sounds right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lester Hamilton was killed at 6:40 this morning. Plenty of time for you to put two in his chest before walking home.

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: I didn’t kill him. But I know who did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you really? Would you care to share?

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: Look, last month the NIH rejected him for human testing. Now, I told him the setback was temporary, but he said he was too close to a breakthrough. He wasn’t going to let a bunch of bureaucratic scientists get in his way. A week later I notice $100,000 missing from the account I set up for him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think he went ahead with human testing without approval.

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: Yes. In secret. And then he tells me to take a hike. I think he had that breakthrough. I think the Ambrosia Project worked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a very interesting theory, Mr. Randolph, but you still haven’t told us who you think killed Hamilton.

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: If he was doing illegal testing, where were his test subjects coming from, hmm? I can tell you this – they weren’t clean cut college kids. They’re the kind of folks who don’t like needles and are likely to possess firearms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here’s my view, and unlike yours, mine is based on fact. You sunk millions into Hamilton’s research and just as you thought that Hamilton was making a breakthrough, he cut you off. That is motive. You have a large caliber gun; Hamilton just happened to have been shot with a large caliber gun. That is means. And you were seen arguing with Hamilton ten minutes before he was killed. That is opportunity.

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: That’s conjecture, Detective. You have no proof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, I do. CSU just found that your .45 caliber gun was fired this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ouch. You know what we call that. The smoking gun.

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: Well, that had nothing to do with Hamilton. There was a flock of pigeons on my roof this morning, squawking. I was trying to sleep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pigeons. That’s what you’re going to go with?

utterance.speaker: RANDOLPH
utterance.content: Given that the only evidence you have is frozen inside Mr. Hamilton, yeah, that’s what I’m going with. In the meantime, I’d like my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Smug, self satisfied son of a b*itch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, but with no witness to the shooting all we’ve got is a gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And since we can’t match ballistics without the bullets, we can’t even prove it’s the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Thank you, Mr. Castle. I know how ballistics works.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, we need that body otherwise we don’t have a case.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ll call the DA. I don’t care if case law is murky. We have a suspect now.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Here’s the deal, boys. The DA’s office believes that we currently have sufficient grounds to obtain a warrant and take custody of Lester Hamilton’s body as evidence in his murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: ROSEN
utterance.content: You know we’ll fight you, right?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Do you really want to risk that case law will be established on the basis of these extraordinary circumstances? Case law that will limit the rights of all your clients? Now, I’m hoping that we can find another way, but I need that body.

utterance.speaker: ROSEN
utterance.content: We can’t surrender our client’s chance at a long productive future life because it proves inconvenient for the state.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then I’m sure you’ll be hearing from the District Attorney’s office shortly.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: There may be another way.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: Our admittance x-rays show that Hamilton’s heart was damaged by the bullets, so maintaining the body is no longer a priority. Cryonics is mostly about preserving the brain. By the time the technology exists to revive Hamilton, we’ll surely be able to regenerate our bodies.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: Bottom line, we can keep the courts out of this. And you can have Hamilton’s body immediately, if you agree to leave his head in storage at Passageway.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Then we have a deal. Now all we need to is match ballistics to Randolph’s gun.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: They’re not a match.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean, they’re not a match?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I mean, the bullets in Lester Hamilton’s chest were not fired by Beau Randolph’s gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, I just sit down here all day and make stuff up. Of course I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Here’s the ballistics report. Randolph’s gun is a .45. Headless here was shot with a .38.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Getting that body was supposed to sew our case up, not blow it apart. How could those bullets not match?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have a theory, but you’re not going to like it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’m open to anything right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Randolph is innocent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re right. I don’t like it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Randolph couldn’t be the only one who wanted Hamilton’s research. Maybe a competing life extension researcher?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe. I’m going to call his wife up and see what she knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alexis?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s spinning out. She’s never not gotten something she’s set her sights on. Do you mind if I –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. You should be with her now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Castle. I think I can manage without you for a few hours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Don’t look so happy about it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Ryan. What’s up, man? Where you been?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Down at the college, running down that break in in Hamilton’s office. So, listen to this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What the hell is this?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That, my friend, is Beau Randolph’s alibi.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A dead pigeon?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: CSU found it on the roof of his building with a slug in its belly from his .45.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Seriously? So Randolph really did commit murder, huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m just writing him up for animal cruelty right now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe there’s still time to cryonically freeze the little guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hamilton’s office?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, so, first off, Hudson’s campus cops, wow. I know what we’ll be doing when we’re fried and don’t care anymore. At least they bagged the evidence. We were able to pull prints off of Hamilton’s smashed computer. They matched one of his students, an Eddie Peck. Straight As, no record.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then what was he doing breaking into Hamilton’s office and smashing his computer?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, tell me If this answers your question. His father is a lead researcher at Smith Briar Pharmaceuticals.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Big Pharma.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Young Peck stole Hamilton’s research for his dad.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Does that look familiar, Peck?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It should. It had your prints all over it. We know you broke into Hamilton’s office. What were you looking for?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE PECK
utterance.content: It wasn’t supposed to turn out this way, I swear. I just – I didn’t want to be a disappointment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: To who? Your father? You did this for him, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: You don’t know what he’s like.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What did you do with the research?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: What research?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Professor Hamilton’s. The Ambrosia Project. It was inside his briefcase and that’s why you killed him, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Killed him? No, no! I asked him to change my grade.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I met this girl, Susie, at the beginning of the semester. I’d never been in love before, but I fell hard, man. When I wasn’t with her all I could do was daydream about her, you know?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell are you talking about? What does your love life have to do with any of this?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Because of Susie I didn’t study for Professor Hamilton’s midterm. I got an F. We don’t get Fs in my family, especially in bio. My father would kill me. So I broke in to Hamilton’s office and tried to change the grade in his computer. But I didn’t know his password. I got frustrated and threw it against the wall.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t you lie to me, Peck. Hamilton’s grade report said you got an A on his midterm.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: That’s because the next day I followed him, tried to work up the courage to beg him to change my grade. But before I could, we were in this scary neighborhood and he went into this seedy hotel.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And what was he doing there?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I don’t know. But he came out like an hour later and when he saw me he totally wigged. Like, eyes popping out of his head crazy. He offered to change my F to an A in exchange for me never telling anyone he was there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This hotel have a name?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: The 130th Street Inn.

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: That little beady eyed guy in 24, a big time scientist? Get out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How long had he been coming here?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: Ah… booked his room solid for the last month. Paid cash.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was he doing here for a month?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: Sweet pea. This is a don’t ask, don’t tell hotel.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you didn’t ask, but could you tell?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: Little dude made a big deal about no one ever going into his room for any reason. Not even to clean. I figured he had a blowup doll collection or something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is this a boy in the plastic bubble thing or what?

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: I’ll tell you something. I am not cleaning this up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Please stay back, ma’am.

utterance.speaker: LANDLADY
utterance.content: Twist my arm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude, there better not be body parts in there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Scalpels … drill… is that a laser?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Lidocaine. That’s an anesthetic.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Syringes. It’s an operating room, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who the hell is Hamilton operating on and why here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His Ambrosia Project. They said he was on the verge of a major breakthrough but got turned down for human testing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like Beau Randolph was right. Hamilton decided not to wait.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who would sign up for an illegal experimentation of an untested surgical procedure?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. Make you feel better, live longer … hell, I’d give it a try. Though not in a sleazy hotel. I’d need five stars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. Any sign of Alexis this morning?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh … no.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When I got home last night, she was sacked out on the couch. I had to carry her up to bed. That’s the first time in years.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Poor baby. She hasn’t been herself since getting that rejection letter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, sweetheart. What’s in the box?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: My life of lies.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m throwing it all out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, honey, all your awards? You worked hard for these!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did I? Half of them are participation trophies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Super peewee soccer. You remember the time … … you scored a goal off your head and you didn’t even realize it?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And I got a trophy for that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We didn’t even win a single game.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, c’mon. You weren’t even supposed to keep score.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah well, Stanford keeps score.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, c’mon, Alexis. Some of these awards are for actual achievements. Franklin Middle School spelling bee champ, Marlowe Prep French award…

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The one I wanted was Stanford.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweetheart, I know Ashley is going to Stanford –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This has nothing to do with Ashley! It’s me, Dad. I’m a failure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, just because you didn’t get into one school does not make you a failure. But you are going to have to accept that you didn’t get in and move on.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just wanted to give her the childhood I never had. Maybe I overprotected her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You gave her a great childhood, Castle. It’s not a bad thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not if she’s incapable of handling rejection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we all get our hearts broken eventually. Just give her some time. She’ll find her way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As long as she doesn’t end up auditioning for Beau Randolph.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, any word on what was going on in Hamilton’s hotel of horrors?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie’s running test results on the bloody instruments, but so far it looks like at least one test subject wasn’t pleased with the results. CSU found that note in the hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “You told me this would work. I trusted you.” Looks like Beau Randolph was right. Hamilton was doing human testing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like it didn’t go as planned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Frankenstein’s monster came back and killed Frankenstein.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No luck IDing the note’s author. The only prints CSU found in the room were Hamilton’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Hamilton’s wife?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We checked with her, his colleagues, and his students. No one even knew he was doing any secret research.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, someone knew about it. Canvass around the hotel. There’s a big homeless population in the area. Maybe that’s where he got his subjects.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I don’t get Hamilton on a character level. Why would he risk his reputation, his safety, to do illegal testing in some flop house? I mean, he was ready to give away his research, so it wasn’t the money. Why was he in such a big rush?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie’s got the DNA results.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So did the labs tell us who Hamilton’s test subjects were?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Preliminary DNA results from the needles and the drill show that the DNA is all from the same person. Lester Hamilton.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … Lester wasn’t doing to procedures on someone else. Someone else was doing them to him.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he decided to put his money where his mouth was, using himself as a test subject.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But then who was doing the procedures on him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how did it even get him killed?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Can I just –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe the treatment was a success. Hamilton realized he was on the cusp of a revolutionary life extension breakthrough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my gosh…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could you believe that –

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Guys! Hold up! Stop doing that thing you do for one second. Thank you. Now, all of the theorizing is cute, as usual. But we’ve got a problem.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The Ambrosia Project implant is supposed to be in the patient’s arm. I checked his arms, in fact, I checked every inch of Hamilton’s body. There were no intrusions or wounds anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t understand. I thought you said the needles had his DNA.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: They do. And his brain matter, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whatever they were doing they were doing to his head?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is the only part of Hamilton’s body that you haven’t checked yet.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Get me his head and I can tell you what this is all about.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: We had an agreement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was before, when Mr. Hamilton’s head wasn’t relevant to this case. Now it is.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: Please –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Weiss, I have a warrant and you’re welcome to read it.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: I know it’s legal, but think of Lester Hamilton’s wishes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His wishes right now come second to this murder investigation. Now open the door.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’ll be as minimally invasive as possible, Dr. Weiss.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: Any invasion at all will destroy memory, personality, vital functions …

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: It’s gone. The thermal storage unit should be right there.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You gotta be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you saying that you lost his head?

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA HARRISON
utterance.content: I don’t understand. How does my husband’s head just go missing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s what we’re trying to figure out, Mrs. Hamilton. Do you have any idea who could have operated on him at the 130th Street Inn?

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: I already told Detective Beckett, I don’t know anything about that. Now, I need to find him immediately. I need to make sure that his wishes are being respected.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I understand, and I promise you that we are doing everything that we possibly can –

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: What about Dr. Weiss? He’s in charge over there. Have you spoken to him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Detective Beckett is with him right now.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: I’m just as concerned about Hamilton’s head as you are, Detective.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: There must have been a break in at our storage facility.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A break in. Really? Is that what you’re going with?

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: We’ve never had anything like this happen to one of our clients. It’s the only thing that makes any sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I will tell you what makes sense, Dr. Weiss. Either you’re part of a cover up or you’re a murderer. Or both.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: What? Why- why would I kill anyone? I have a family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, did you take them into consideration when you colluded in moving a body from a murder scene?

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: That was a one in a million circumstance and everyone ended up getting what they needed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why is it that at every step of this investigation you have gotten in my way? Hamilton ends up dead and in your custody. The DA’s about to turn over the body to me and you negotiate to keep the head. I get a warrant for the head and suddenly it ends up missing.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: The only thing I’m guilty of is trying to protect Lester Hamilton’s desire to be cryo-preserved. I don’t know anything about his murder. Please check with my company, there must have been a break in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turns out there was a break in at the Passageway storage facility in the middle of the night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No way. And they took the head?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Security video. Just watch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Last night, 3:32 AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hamilton’s storage container?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who the hell is that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hamilton’s dead friend and colleague.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Boyd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD! Open up, Boyd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t think he’s opening up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He went out the window to the fire escape!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you think?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just excited.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s got the head. Beckett, he’s got the head!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can see that. Dr. Boyd, stop!

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: No…!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Talk about taking a header.

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll get the head!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Got it! I got Hamilton’s head. I think it’s okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You are under arrest for the murder of Lester Hamilton.

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: I didn’t kill him. I was trying to save his life.

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: He’s going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a relief.

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: Why would anyone steal a head?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Boyd, it seems we caught you red handed.

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, why did you steal his head? Did you miss him? We know about your operating room at 130th Street Inn. You were doing surgery on Hamilton’s head, but it had nothing to do with life extension. So either you tell me about it or we find out on our own.

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: He came to me a month ago complaining about severe headaches. An MRI showed that he had stage 4 glioblastoma.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A brain tumor?

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: Inoperable, untreatable. He only had a few months to live.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, why did he go to you? Why didn’t he go to a hospital?

utterance.speaker: BODY
utterance.content: Because as a scientist he knew the limits of current therapies and he was familiar with my work. Nanoparticle genetic theory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: English.

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: Targeted treatment of tumors. I’m years away from human testing but … he was my best friend. How could I say no to him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you set up shop at the hotel to keep it secret?

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: If anyone found out I’d lose my tenure, my funding, reputation. We couldn’t even risk using existing operating suites. Lester swore he wouldn’t even tell Cynthia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then you got the money from Beau Randolph’s fund in order to get your supplies.

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: Yeah. I did five procedures over the month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And was he getting better?

utterance.speaker: BOYD
utterance.content: No. A few days before he was killed I did an MRI that showed that the tumor was still growing. The treatment had failed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A brain tumor. That’s why Hamilton wanted to put his research project online, in hopes that someone would finish his research.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve got Esposito running down Boyd’s alibi just in case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Everything. How do you do it, Dad?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, that letter that you have framed in your office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My first manuscript rejection.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. How can you stand having it there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because it drives me. And I got twenty more of those before Black Pawn ever agreed to publish In a Hail of Bullets. That letter … that letter reminds me of what I’ve overcome. Rejection isn’t failure.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It sure feels like failure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, failure is giving up. Everyone gets rejected. It’s how you handle it that determines where you’ll end up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: My whole life has been about making sure I could get into any college I wanted. What’s it about now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Give it time. You’ll figure it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were any of us at that age? No, it’ll suck until it doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, speaking of sucking – Boyd alibi’ed out. He was at a department breakfast the morning Hamilton was killed. I mean, we caught the guy with our victim’s head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 99 times out of 100 you catch someone with a guy’s head, he killed the guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, Boyd also provided the MRI’s of Hamilton’s head. Lanie confirmed that the tumor would have ravaged his brain in a couple of months.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So in an odd way, he got lucky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, Dr. Weiss said that cryonics was about preserving the brain. If Hamilton had lived, his brain would have been destroyed. Cryonic preservation wouldn’t have been an option.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then our killer inadvertently saved him for the future.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: One lifetime together wasn’t enough. That’s our motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it wasn’t so inadvertent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for coming in, Mrs. Hamilton. I understand that you’ve already spoken to Dr. Boyd.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: Yes. It’s a lot to process.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: How can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we were hoping you could shed some light on some evidence that just came in.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your husband’s computer. The one his student smashed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The tech people here managed to recover a list of recent downloads. Included on that list was Passageway’s contract termination form. Any idea why your husband would download that?

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: No. It must be a mistake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, the tech assured us that the download list was clean.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re sure he didn’t say anything to you about that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because the best I can come up with is that your husband decided that working on his research until his brain gave out was more important to him than cryonically preserving himself. But you disagreed with him, didn’t you, Mrs. Hamilton?

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: How could I disagree with him when I didn’t even know about the tumor?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think you did know, and that’s why you killed him. So he would be preserved for the future before his brain was ravaged.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After shooting him you took his briefcase.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: This is insane. It’s just wild conjecture.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, it’s not. You got rid of the gun, of course, but we found your husband’s briefcase hidden in your building’s basement. There were traces of your husband’s blood on it.

utterance.speaker: CYNTHIA
utterance.content: I gave him that briefcase. When we got engaged. I couldn’t just leave it behind. I had known for weeks that there was something wrong but Lester said it was just stress. And then a coupld of nights ago he passed out when he was getting ready for bed. Then he told me the truth. But … he wasn’t in his right mind. He was too concerned about his research. I needed to protect our future. Our eternity together. It’s what we always dreamed of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Detective, would you consider this to be a crime of passion?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I would consider this a crime of love.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice. Though, that would depend on whether Cynthia Hamilton was in love or insane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, sometimes there’s a fine line between the two.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Dr. Weiss. I have your release forms ready to go.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: I’m grateful, Detective. Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll just need you to sign down there at the bottom and the charges against you and your employees at Passageway will officially be dropped by the department.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: I’m happy to put this behind us.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: It’s a biowatch signal. A client has just flatlined.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: Well, that’s strange.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: The signal. It’s coming from inside this building.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The ring. On her right hand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cyanide pill.

utterance.speaker: WEISS
utterance.content: Detective Beckett? Permission to have my technicians come and get her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, of course.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wouldn’t it be something if they reunited 100, even 1,000 years from now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, anything’s possible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really believe that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s what the great love stories are about, right? Beating the odds?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I hope they make it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
